isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Manifolds and Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) - Cleaning, Inspection and Test - Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) Cooler

figure.caption: EGR cooler with Pressure Test Plates installed

step1.para: Install EGR Cooler Pressure Plates to each end of the EGR cooler assembly. See Special Service Tools.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields when using compressed air for cleaning to reduce the danger from flying debris. Limit the air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Attach an air pressure regulator to the EGR cooler. Connect to shop air supply and adjust air pressure to approximately 172 to 207 kPa (25 to 30 psi).
Completely submerge EGR cooler in sink or large container of water. Inspect for air bubbles coming from coolant passages. Replace if necessary.
Return EGR cooler assembly to service if no leaks are detected. If leaks are detected, replace entire cooler assembly.
